website_summaries.verdict: Slightly older components in this laptop, but it still provides plenty of power for most users.
pros: You'll love the touchscreen option available with this 4K resolution LCD
Extremely sharp display screen that measures 12.5 inches diagonally
Thin and lightweight laptop computer at 2.75 pounds
Even though the processor is a little older, it'll give you the power required for most computing tasks
cons: Display is too small for some
Price could be lower with the older processor

website_summaries.verdict: The Razer Blade Stealth is a rare mix of slick design, great performance and top-notch value in a laptop -- but the great-looking 4K screen on the top-end model takes a major hit on battery life.
pros: The Razer Blade Stealth is slimmer and lighter than similar laptops from Dell and Apple
Even the base model includes a Core i7 processor and fun Chroma backlit keyboard, and future expansion via an external graphics box for gaming is promising
cons: Battery life takes a nosedive with the 4K screen
The promised add-on gaming module still has no price or release details

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Portable
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this laptop for college because it has really good specifications and I've read a lot of good things about it. I was not disappointed. Neither the screen nor the keyboard has any flex, which is indicative of good build quality. The screen is very nice and isn't set in underneath a bezel like a lot of cheaper laptops (something I dislike greatly). The touchscreen functionality is good and the trackpad is large enough that I don't always need to bring a mouse. All in all very pleased with the laptop and look forward to using it more.
customer_reviews.author: Quinton Shipps

customer_reviews.title: These laptops are notoriously unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: Chronically defective item. First time, eventually stopped charging. Second time, the screen played a technicolor laser light show complete with strobes anytime I wanted to press a button. I've RMAed the thing twice and got sent a replacement by Razer that is also defective in a totally different way. Stay far away from this device. When it works, it's great. When it doesn't, you will want to throw it across the room.

customer_reviews.title: get something like the Innergie 'Powergear' USB-C 45 too
customer_reviews.text: My daughter likes it -it appears to do gaming quite well BUT it has recurring charger problems. BEWARE! Customer service is a system of back-and-forth emails, 'we'll get back to you in 24hrs' emails...'...sorry we couldn't respond faster than we wanted to' emails, but fact is, the charger is a HUGE let down -it breaks at the sealed connector through normal use. We are on the third charger in a year and Razer Support won't let us buy more than one at a time -they appear to have a problem, Houston! If you buy this laptop, get something like the Innergie 'Powergear' USB-C 45 too.
